Authors:
Bandarupalli devadatha, Veluri Venkateswara Sarma, E. B. G.
Jones
Title:
Deniquelata vittalii sp.nov, a new Indian saprobic marine
fungus on Suaeda monoica from Muthupet mangroves, East coast of
India.
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes  Didymosphaeriaceae  Pleosporales 
Molecular phylogeny  Nomenclature
Abstract:
Deniquelata vittalii a novel species of marine fungi in
the genus Deniquelata found saprobic on decaying wood of Suaeda monoica
collected from Muthupet mangroves, southeast coast of India was
described and illustrated herein. Morphologically it resembles
Deniquelata barringtoniae but obviously distinct in having larger
ascomatal, asci and ascospore dimensions, brown ascospores (with 35
transverse septa. Further phylogenetic analyses inferred from combined
LSU, SSU and ITS dataset indicate that Deniquelata vittalii share a
sister relation with D. barringtoniae with higher statistical support
and form a strongly supported monophyletic clade. Both morphological
differences and DNA based sequence data strongly supports the
establishment of our new taxon.
